name: The Climber
description: the start of the climber is bad, like 4/10 type writing completely carried by the art where there is zero subtlety with anything, like straight up the teacher says 'could it be something in his past that made him shut his heart'. it had bad pacing like they said that mori is changing after knowing him for like 2 weeks and it felt slow and fast at the same time somehow so i probably would have dropped this but apparently after volume 3 the original author left and the artist had to do his job for him, and the artist immediately killed off most of the side characters literally or by turning them into whores. he changed the plot from a sports manga to a psychological manga with climbing as a backdrop to it with a massive amount of symbolism and the art kept getting better and better and by the final climb it had reached a peak as high as even berserk and vagabond in my opinion. the final climb was probably my favourite arc and ending in all of manga and hit so hard not knowing if he would live or die until the very end. i did not move for the entire duration of it. this is peak literally and figuratively (im a comedic genius).

name: My Boss's Special Request
description: how did they fit bad characters with a loser mc who complains too much, a boring plot, bad comedy, found time to fit in a cliche why is my heart beating so fast scene and had him defend the boss from trash talk less than 10 chapters after he did the same thing all in a single package? the only saving grace from this dropping any lower is that the side plot about the celebrity guy getting 0 bitches was pretty funny and also you can read 40 chapters of it in like an hour.

name: Akumetsu
description: action packed with a protagonist that is fun to watch, has actual goals and a code of conduct with great art and some of the most creative scenes ive ever seen. only problem is that this is a criticism of the japan when it was released and its getting pretty old having ended in 2006 and also im not japanese so it takes a little bit of research for some it to make sense (also the one man one kill thing is kind of true but they are all the same guy so its debatable but its fine i guess).

name: Everyone Else is A Returnee
description: such a cool premise and then they just played it for laughs even though they werent funny. usually i read something bad but entertaining to relax after reading intense shit like berserk but this just made me more angry.

name: Death Note
description: this is like playing multiple separate games of 5d chess except you cant see the board, all the chess pieces are just grey rectangles, you cant see what your opponent is doing and just have to guess and if you move wrong once you die but also sometimes some random girl snaps either your board or your opponents board in half and destroys all your pieces

name: The Strongest Earthbound Spirit and the Guy With No Spiritual Sense

name: Berserk
description: i dont know how to explain this but the swings feel so real in berserk, like i can feel them and can tell when guts gets stronger just by how impactful his swings are and i hear an audible boom anytime he swings dragon slayer, you see the wind up and then just destruction, no wind up, just slow and deliberate movements and then the explosion of whoever he was fighting. the eclipse was actually peak like it got built up so well by people talking about it so you knew it was bad and then it happened and holy shit it was just as bad as they built up to.

name: Neon Genesis Evangelion
description: the most overhyped series. its boring and repetitive, i hate every character and even if they are realistic it doesnt change the fact that shinji is a little bitch boy, asuka is just a bitch and rei is hardly a person who has almost 0 character development. the plot is so complicated and convoluted with a mystery that is impossible to understand without seeing other evangelion media and forgive me for wanting a series to be able to be digested without going through other movies just to get an understanding of a mystery that should have been answered at the start. no characters ever die, and if they do they are alive in the next episode so i am never worried and the symbolism looks cool but is meaningless and because it looks cool was literally the reason it was added.
